content.new:
When using `Joint::SetPosition` using Bullet as the physics engine as shown in [this](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2505/setaxis-implementation-incorrect-for-dart) regression test, if the joint position is set to a value not on the axis of the joint, the motion of the attached link is incorrect. Furthermore, as shown in the gif below, the joint itself moves as `Joint::SetPosition` is called with different angles

![Peek 2018-12-07 17-09.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3318440981-Peek%202018-12-07%2017-09.gif)

Here is the same set of angles using ODE

![Peek 2018-12-07 17-08.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1113494955-Peek%202018-12-07%2017-08.gif)
content.old:
When using `Joint::SetPosition` using Bullet as the physics engine as shown in [this](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2505/setaxis-implementation-incorrect-for-dart) regression test, if the joint position is set to a value not on the axis of the joint, the motion of the attached link is incorrect. Furthermore, as shown in the gif below, the joint itself moves as `Joint::SetPosition` is called with different angles

![Peek 2018-12-07 17-09.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3318440981-Peek%202018-12-07%2017-09.gif)

Here is the same set of angles using ODE
![Peek 2018-12-07 17-08.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1113494955-Peek%202018-12-07%2017-08.gif)
